website_summaries.verdict: A 140 watt handheld blender that features an 8,000 RPM speed and a 12,000 RPM speed.
pros: This unit creates a vortex while spinning, which pulls food in to the blade to help ensure a more consistent mixing
It is also manufacture to offer reduced vibrations and run quieter so it is more comfortable to use
The included mixing cup is appreciated
cons: Be sure that the blade is securely fastened before using so it doesn't come off

customer_reviews.title: Far superior to splittable immersion blender models.
customer_reviews.text: I've used many immersion blenders before, but this is the best one, hands down. I have killed so many of the others, all because the split design of those models, supposedly for "easy cleaning," but the problem is that if even a little bit of water gets inside, that always ends up jamming the axle shaft, or my last one from Cuisinart had a cheap plastic driver that the axle eventually wore out. This one is an all-in-one, solid metal model, so there should be no problems like the split models.
customer_reviews.author: John Benson

customer_reviews.title: Magic Mayonnaise!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this stick blender. I use it to make Fermented Mayonnaise in my Probiotic Jar. It is the whisk blade that works so well, and when my cheap chinese stick blender with this special whisk blade broke that I decided to purchase a Bamix. It's so awesome because you can dump all the mayo ingredients in with the oil and it just emulsifies it like magic. No oil drizzling. This recipe is available at ProbioticJar dot com. After years of wanting to make healthy mayonnaise, I finally have the tools and the know-how. Here's a picture of my favorite tomato sandwich on sourdough!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Really Happy With This!
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a much cheaper immersion blender with this, so I know the difference between mediocre and great. This is very well made and works like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Originally purchased a Bamix Hand Blender like this, 20-25 years ago from a television promotion ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased a Bamix Hand Blender like this, 20-25 years ago from a television promotion for $178. It is still going strong, however I left it for my "X" because I didn't think that I would miss it. After 10 years of being without it, I finally ordered this one, not knowing the model # that I originally purchased. With the quality and reputation of this Hand Blender, I was not afraid to purchase a used one. It was $113, however I decided to apply for Amazon Visa in order to get $70, additionally taken off the price...so I only paid $43!!!! Way to go Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Pookie4456

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I love the thing. Could use my effective and indestructible Cuisinart stick, but this one has a personal touch. For the lady who complained she couldn't separate the bit from the stem -- keep a glass of warm, sudsy water handy. Run the mixer a moment in it Every Time before you put it up. Otherwise, crud builds up between the spindle & head. UPDATE: A year passed and I love it even more. Tiny blade puree's an 8Qt pot of beans more efficiently than the C brand (which now wobbles). Don't know if a year of big bean pots will wear this out, but it does a wonderful job. High speed can flip breaker switch sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: CAT Lady

customer_reviews.title: Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Can’t complain. My other Bamix started to failed and overheat after many years of use. Since Singapore agent has very very bad service I have no choice but to buy a new one. Unfortunately I forgot about the voltage. Luckily I managed to exchange the power supply and it works. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: gcmonkey

customer_reviews.title: Top of the Line
customer_reviews.text: I have been shopping for a submersible blender for awhile and so glad I ordered this one. Great manufacturer, the weight and design are perfect
customer_reviews.author: Kathy D

customer_reviews.title: fabulous product so far!
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box (after washing and sterilizing), this thing is fabulous. Made a potato base soup and it was blended so smooth within minutes, and quite notably quiet at the job! It has a very comfortable hand grip, not too heavy, and very easy to clean. Also made pureed steak for baby food - quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Live Aloha

customer_reviews.title: I love my Bamix
customer_reviews.text: I love my Bamix! I had purchased one about 30 years ago and it finally died. My new one works just as good as the first one and it's much prettier.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Rios

customer_reviews.title: Don't like the scraping mark it makes on the bottom of ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really well! Make sure you push in the attchments really hard as the first time I used it the blades came off. Don't like the scraping mark it makes on the bottom of the pots.
customer_reviews.author: Lenie

customer_reviews.title: Disapointment
customer_reviews.text: This unit is under-powered for most jobs, it is not heavy duty or powerful. Big disappointment based on the reviews. We cook a lot and for the money and reviews we expected much more.
customer_reviews.author: David Ring

customer_reviews.title: great kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: performs as advertised. has plenty of power and is easy to use. for making pureed soups it saves alot of work and extra dishes. would highly recommend for anyone who enjoys cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Sonja G.

customer_reviews.title: Best blender I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I also purchased a pink blender and received a silver one instead. However, I really don't care. I'm so impressed with the way I can take a half cup of skim milk and in seconds whip it into over two cups of stiff white peaks of foam to top drinks and fruit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Point

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended to me by a weight loss yahoo group for whipping up bulletproof coffee. I found that it whips up a chocolate malt in no time. Very heavy duty and glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Schwager

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.Replace a 20 year old Bamix.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using a Bamix for over 20 year and I am very satisfy.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B Pelletier

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: The Bamix has to be the best mixing wand in the market. It is great quality, efficient, ergonomic and reliable. You can't go wrong with one of these.
customer_reviews.author: Mark P

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Had one that lasted about 25 years, so had to buy another one. Love it
customer_reviews.author: kelsey02

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Replacing our previous " thunderstick" from over 10 years of use!
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My husband was thrilled and amazed at how strong the motor is and loves his new Victorinox emulsion mixer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Same quality as I bought my first one over twenty years ago ...
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Complete order not received
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with my purchase of two bamix blenders. I didn't receive one of the mixing cups though.
customer_reviews.author: Jana Hartzell

customer_reviews.title: Bamix immersion blender
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a cheaper Black & Decker brand immersion blender several years ago, and the frame cracked after just a few uses. When I decided to buy a new one, I researched many online ratings and reviews to help determine which brand is best, and Bamix always came to the forefront. It is pricey, but you get what you pay for in it's superior engineering.. quality design and exceptional performance. The first time I turned it on, I was very impressed by how quiet and powerful it is. I love using it, and cleanup is easy.
customer_reviews.author: sherbem

customer_reviews.title: This basic model is all you need
customer_reviews.text: Did a lot of research to find an immersion blender that appeared to be free from carcinogens as well as highly effective at a reasonable price. This basic Bamix model did not disappoint! Seems to be no reason to spend more for any other model. Pureed my instant pot soup creation easily with very uniform consistency. Loving it so far!
customer_reviews.author: vizlagal

customer_reviews.title: Ater 30 years
customer_reviews.text: I don't love it. But my wife does. I got this for her for Christmas to replace a Bamix she's had for 30 plus years. The bearings on that one seized up and it made her very sad because it was one of her favorite and most useful kitchen tools. I hope the new replacement lasts anothe 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry

customer_reviews.title: best immersion blender
customer_reviews.text: I bought this due to the simplicity of the design. It's lightweight, easy to use, and super easy to clean. I use it mainly to blend soups, but will try for mayo soon. So much better than the giant, heavy, stainless, industrial ones available everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: fancydancey

customer_reviews.title: Best Blender I have found.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Bamix Blender I have owned. The first one last about 10 years. I used it everyday sometimes more that once a day.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Awesome , very versatile tool.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, solidly made device. Powerful and with great versatility. My only regret is not buying it sooner. I use it every day.
customer_reviews.author: Ceci G.

customer_reviews.title: A+ rating on service and quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bamix arrived quickly. Runs fine. This will be the 2nd Bamix we've owned. The first lasted 15+ years.
customer_reviews.author: James K

customer_reviews.title: LOVE! LOVE
customer_reviews.text: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! I bought this for my partner this past Christmas , who, upon opening the gift sobbed with happiness about how he had wanted a Bamix since he was 8 years old. He is now 33. Now I know what all those tears were about...this hand held blender is truly the ROCK STAR OF THE CULINARY WORLD!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Lomas

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool
customer_reviews.text: This device is easy to use, does a good job, saves me from dirtying additional dishes/pots, is easy to clean and doesn't take up a lot of space in the kitchen. What more could you want? Well, OK, a lower price. I use it mostly for making soups or sauces.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy Kotzman

customer_reviews.title: Super blender
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hand immersion blender available! I had one for 20 years before it quit working. I was excited to find this model on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Stolberg

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I bought a Bamix stick blender 35+ years ago at a promotional "Kitchen appliance demo" . Paid $99. We were newlyweds and med students, (poor financially) but the sales pitch-demo surely did sell us. Still using it today and it's going strong!!!! I've already made the decision that if it ever 'dies' we will only buy BAMIX to replace it. Heavy duty with all metal parts and worth every penny we spent. For what we paid, and the number of years we've used it, it's the least expensive appliance we've ever owned!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: bought this bamix immersion blender and am very pleased with it. i like that it has various attachments for chopping, mixing, frothing, etc. comes with a wall mount and mixing container. the blender has 2 push button speeds, and the handle is a comfortable fit. r.p.m. is 10,000/15,000 rev per minute. it is very quiet to run. appears to be a solidily buildt and hopefully will last for years of continued use. overall a great investment for any cook.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph L. Kolb

customer_reviews.title: gift for mom
customer_reviews.text: This product seemed awesome at first, I even got a pick one (my mom and I both have all pink appliances) and it worked really well at first. Then around christmas when my mom was using it a lot black stuff started to come out of the bottom and ruined some cookie mixes. It seemed to be like oil or grease that makes it spin, but we dont know how to make that stop! it is also very powerful and if you are not careful you will have mix all over the kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: Neena

customer_reviews.title: Lasts over 30 years
customer_reviews.text: This is my best kitchen machine. We bought one when our daughter was born, now we're getting one for her as a 30 year birthday present!
customer_reviews.author: Ingrid Franzon

customer_reviews.title: Bleh
customer_reviews.text: I bought this immersion blender after seeing it demo'd at Costco... and it broke. Twice. I returned it the first time within a couple months & got a replacement one, which also broke. It has a lifetime warranty, but ultimately it's more of a pain to continually return/exchange/etc. a product. I'm throwing it away (finally) & am replacing it with a Cuisinart.
customer_reviews.author: K. K. DeLeo

customer_reviews.title: Bamix warranty and service: Don't count on it.
customer_reviews.text: Our Bamix M133 died suddenly. Our blender had been used very little and had never been dropped. Bamixx service had nothing to offer and was not at all helpful on the telephone. We wanted to send it in for service. So we disassembled it ourselves and found a broken wire where the main power cord connects with a soldered connection. Easily re-soldered. The device is now working perfectly once again, but no thanks to Bamix.
customer_reviews.author: ir rad

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product - works like a charm.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Bamix M133 for many years. It works just as great now as when I bought it. It's an excellent product. I used to work as a chef and this always went to work with me. On rare occasion the blade is a little difficult to remove (let it sit in a container of hot water for a few minutes and it comes off easier) but that's the closest thing to a problem I've ever had with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality, power and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift after owning a similar Bamix for over a decade. Never a problem. Always enough power. Simple to clean. Plus some new models with longer reach and more color options.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Haven't bought Mayo in 13 years
customer_reviews.text: Well after 13 years of owning our first Bamix M133 it seems to be slowing down. But in those 13 years we've used it lots. We make mayo every couple of weeks, we make shakes and soups. I don't think we can live without it...so here I am on Amazon ordering another one. I remember seeing it demo'd at a trade show and when I asked the price and they said $200 I said that was crazy. But they did an amazing demo and we bought it. I'm sure glad we did.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Klenk

customer_reviews.title: Warning about Bamix warranty
customer_reviews.text: Bamix has informed me they do not honor the 3 year warranty from any unauthorized retailer which includes Amazon and almost everyone else. Amazon concurs, saying it must be sold by Amazon, not just fullfilled by Amazon for the warranty to be good. Even then, the manufacturer may refuse, but Amazon says they will back it up themselves regardless, if they sold it, but not if they just fullfilled it. Says a lot about Bamix, and none of it good, would'nt you say? Bamix center in US--Swissarmy.com--800-442-2706 EST
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: If you only ever buy one kitchen food processor
customer_reviews.text: this is my most favourite gadget, I bought it just over 12 months ago and it does what it says on the can. Amazing product, use it everyday, keep it on top of my microwave. If you are scared of price,I can honestly say so was I, but this machine has made all my other gadgets redundant. Cannot praise it enough. A must buy
customer_reviews.author: sueprice

product_meta.title: Bamix M133 Mono Immersion Hand Blender – Light Grey – 3 Stainless Steel Interchangeable Blades – 140W 120V 60Hz with US plug – Includes 3 Blades, 2 ½ Cup Beaker, Wall Bracket, and Recipe Booklet
feature_bullets: HANDBUILT IN SWITZERLAND: Whether you are a professional chef or home cook, our immersion blender will get any cooking job done. Swiss made, includes 3 interchangeable blades, a 2 ½ cup beaker, and a wall bracket for easy storage.

3 INTERCHANGEABLE BLADES: With an aerating, blending, and chopping blade, you get the multifunctionality of multiple kitchen appliances all in one. Create a perfect vortex to draw food into blades for efficient mixing then run under water for easy cleaning.

POWERFUL AND PRECISE: A powerful 140-watt A/C motor keeps constant, precise speed under heavy loads. With 2 speeds (8,000 RPM and 12,000 RPM), a push button control for continuous or pulse actions, and an ergonomic handle, our blender maintains efficient pulses with less vibration and noise.

The body is PA6 safety rated nylon and fully sealed so the blender can be submerged to seam below speed controls. Stick is chromated brass. Both are high heat resistant to safely use in boiling liquids or hot pots.
Open head design creates a perfect vortex to draw food into the blades for faster and more efficient mixing. All parts are easy to clean under running water.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars134 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
